===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=とうごうしっちょうしょう|統合|tr1=tōgō|t1=comprehensive|失調|tr2=shitchō|t2=disharmony, imbalance|pos2=especially implying the loss of a previous harmony or balance|症|tr3=shō|t3=disorder}}.

Coined in 2002 by the Japanese Society of Psychiatry and Neurology as a replacement for the older term {{m|ja|精神分裂病|tr=seishin bunretsu byō|lit=mind/intellect split/break disease}}, due to confusion regarding the term and the diagnosis. See {{ja-l|精神分裂病}} for more.
